pages.text: Tapinocephalus was a large herbivorous dinocephalian that lived during the Permian period. It had a massive bony skull roof and a short snout. It may have engaged in headbutting with each other for mates or for territory. It could grow up to over 3 meters in length and they had strong robust bodies and limbs.
